attributes.action: London to explore renegotiating EU relationship based on a 60% "remain" vote
attributes.additional_details:
Over 600,000 more people in London than in Scotland voted to remain in the EU. 

London generates around 20% of the UK's gross domestic product.

There are close to one million Europeans living in London.
attributes.background: In Scotland, a 62% remain vote may trigger another referendum on independence. Scotland being forced to leave the EU against its will is considered "democratically unacceptable". In London, by comparison, the remain vote was 59.9%. We should be given the same choice over our future EU relationship.

rejection.details: This petition appears to be addressed to the Greater London Authority. The UK Government and Parliament Petitions website can only be used for petitions which are addressed to central government or to Parliament.
